events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred at a local intersection involving another vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to multiple vehicle damages described.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's auto accident claim for better service.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer of support.
Request sent to customer asking for police report, photos of the accident, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos, and garage quotes.
Claim investigation commenced to verify liability and assess extent of damage to all vehicles involved.
Investigation findings completed confirming customer was not at fault for the collision incident.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs and related expenses for the vehicle damage.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the timely communication from agent.
Claim was approved officially, confirming the allocated funds for the vehicle repair and compensation.
Insurance payment was issued to the repair shop and customerâ€™s account to cover all approved costs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and customer confirmation.
All claim documents and correspondences were archived securely for future reference and compliance.
